intro: Willdenowia galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's willdenowia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Willdenowia galpinii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
